page.title: 12TRANSPORT cont'd
page.content: {RAILWAYS ________ The railway line between London and Penzance (mentioned on Page 8) cuts across one corner of our area. Holidaymakers (known to native Cornishmen as "emmets"; lit. 'ants', taken from the Cornish language) form the bulk of the users on the line, especially during the tourist months in summer. Most of the trains used on the line are passenger HST125s, and class 50 or class 47 locomotives. Occassionally, but gradually less frequently, a class 37 locomotive hauls a goods train along the line.
